Description: Rectangular wooden scribal palette with slot for pens.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes, 'small temple of Isis' (Deir el-Medina)
Acquisition notes: Sotheby's sale catalogue of the collection of James Burton, 25 July 1836, lot 232, plate I (9), notes that the palette was found in association with razor and leather case (EA 37198, 37180) and also with writing board EA 5601 and other 'instruments', acquired at the Salt sale 1835, lot 245.
